title.narrative: RESET II - Strengthening vulnerable households in Liben

description.narrative: A large part of the population in Liben Zone (Somali Region, Ethiopia) is vulnerable to drought. Cordaid will implement the project 'Resilience building and creation of economic opportunities in Ethiopia' with consortium partners, focusing on improving access to basic services, enhancing income opportunities (diversification), improving Disaster Risk Management capacity and Research & Knowledge management.

The overall objective is to strengthen economic opportunities and resilience of the most vulnerable communities to human-induced and natural disaster crises, through measures that will increase livelihoods and employment and better access to basic services in Liben Zone, Somali Region (Ethiopia).

The project focuses on poor pastoralists, dry-land farmers and agro-pastoralists, jobless urban youth, poor female headed households, pastoral drop-outs, children, pregnant and lactating women, and elders. In total, the primary beneficiaries amount 99,952 persons (55,563 female and 44,389 male) in 15,865 households. The number of indirect beneficiaries of the 9 selected catchment areas in the Woredas Dolo-Ado, Moyale, Mubarak and Dheka Suftu is 218,645 persons.

title.narrative: Saving Lives Corporate Indicators
Number of people with improved food security

description.narrative: Number of households with an improved score on the household food insecurity access scale (HFIAS) compared to the baseline score. This score is a household score and needs to be translated to the number of individual household members (based on average household size).

title.narrative: Sustainable Livelihoods Thematic Indicators
Number of communities reached
Number of CSOs/NGOs able to facilitate a community managed resilience/DRR process
Number of Resilience Action Plans developed at community/local level

description.narrative: Number of communities which have been supported by Cordaid and/or partners and developed joint action plans to enhance resilience at the community/local level

title.narrative: Number of communities implementing Resilience measures

description.narrative: Number of targeted communities which have been supported by Cordaid and/or partners and (raise funds for and) carry out their action plans by implementing resilience interventions at the community/ local level

title.narrative: Number of Participatory Disaster Risk Analysis (PDRAs) done at community/local level
Number of DRR/Resilience committees established and functioning at local level
Number of direct beneficiaries enhanced their resilience through community level resilience activities
Sustainable Livelihoods Corporate Indicators
Number of jobs created

description.narrative: Number of new jobs created by MSMEs, comparing before and after Cordaid's intervention (from baseline to Endline), counting only new jobs (not net jobs)

title.narrative: Number of people with increased access to good quantity and quality of food through own production or income

description.narrative: Basic food needs: assistance, combined with beneficiaries' own resources, to international standard of 2100 kcal per person per day for the period of the action. Any kind of transfer modality (in-kind, voucher, cash) and combination thereof with objective to ensure immediate access to the necessary food commodities. This may include supplementary foods provided alongside general distribution for vulnerable people.

title.narrative: Number of people with improved food security

description.narrative: Number of households with an improved score on the household food insecurity access scale (HFIAS) compared to the baseline score. This score is a household score and needs to be translated to the number of individual household members (based on average household size).

title.narrative: Number of people supported to improve and/or develop their entrepreneurship prospects

description.narrative: Number of people (within the project's target beneficiary group) supported by Cordaid interventions designed to assist them to develop / improve their entrepreneurship (possibilities)

title.narrative: Number of unemployed youth successfully supported into (self)employment

description.narrative: Number of youth who have secured employment, comparing from before the intervention to after (baseline to Endline). NB Both waged employment and self-employment (i.e. are employed by someone else or have started their own business)

title.narrative: Number of farmers applying good agricultural practices

description.narrative: Number of farmers that apply Good Agricultural Practices (GAP). GAP activities encompass different components of agricultural practice: dealing with agricultural inputs, handling fertilizers and pesticides use, harvesting practices and personal and product safety and hygiene (when applicable according to EU import regulations)

title.narrative: Number of households with more diversified livelihoods (income generation)

description.narrative: Number of households that have been able to diversify their primary livelihood through Cordaid interventions on this field. Diversification here means the process by which rural families construct a diverse portfolio of activities and social support capabilities in order to survive and to improve their standards of living.

title.narrative: Number of people reached with employment interventions

description.narrative: Number of people (within the project's target beneficiary group) supported by Cordaid interventions to obtain decent employment A decent employment respects the fundamental rights of the human person as well as the rights of workers in terms of conditions of work safety and remuneration. .. respect for the physical and mental integrity of the worker in the exercise of his/her employment (in accordance finally with the ILO regulations for decent work) .

title.narrative: Number of beneficiaries reached (SU)

description.narrative: Number of people who have benefitted (directly or indirectly) through a Cordaid Sustainable Livelihoods Intervention

title.narrative: Sustainable Livelihoods Project Specific Indicators
Number of communities having DRR plan and contingency plan linked to government/woreda sector plan
Number of communities providing regular (12 months / year) EW monitoring data to the woreda/zone/region
Number of target group receiving credit/loans for their business plan
Number of community managed DRR committees established and functioning
Number of target HHs with acquired skill and inputs to run income generating opportunities
Number of kebeles declared ODF
Number of people receiving rural advisory services with EU support
Number of HH accessing water harvesting structures (for livestock use)
Area (ha) of arable land under irrigation
Area (ha) of land covered under dry land farming practice attributable to RESET
Number of client HHs with adequate knowledge on Infant and young child feeding (IYCF)-7.9 points out of 14
Area (ha) of community range lands rehabilitated attributable to RESET
Number of people from target vulnerable communities gaining access to markets for targeted value chain products
Number of target group accessing veterinary services/veterinary service coverage
Number of target group trained in sustainable land and water management practices
Number of health professionals trained with EU support
Number of 1-year old fully immunised against diphtheria, tetanus, whooping cough, hepatitis B and Haemophilic influenza type b and/or measles, polio
Number of water systems rehabilitated (for human use)
